skills.name: Incident Response case
keywords: 1.Investigated DDoS attack (requests from Myanmar) logs from Cloudflare WAF event logs for a gamming company.
2.Found that 95% of attack traffic was blocked by Cloudflare managed rules.(both account level and zone level.)
3.Found zone level custom-waf was not triggered.
4.Suspecting the 5 % volume attacks were DNS amplification attack attempts using Cloudflare DNS resolver.
5.Ask for their local event logs contains cf tag(like CF-Ray IDs) or not.
6.Answer: some of them are, some of them are not.
7.Conclusion: Ips are possibly exposed, so attackers can use cloudflare free account to amp attack, or directly http flood to their web server.
8.Suggestion: set connection between cloudflare and original servers from full to strict mode.

Strong in CI/CD automation (GitHub Actions, Terraform), n8n workflow automation, cloud networking, and infrastructure as code (IaC), but limited full production Kubernetes experience.
